text:
When a jar file is created with the "jar" task, the Java2 SDK 1.3 "jar" command 
does not recognize that the file contains any files.  However, WinZip does 
recognize that the file contains the files I put in it, and classes can be read 
from it when it is placed in the CLASSPATH.

For example, when I run the command "jar -tf <jar file>," the command does not 
list any files.  "jar -xf <jar file>" also does not extract anything.

I ran "jar" on both Windows Pro 2000 and Red Hat Linux 7.0, and it didn't see 
the files' contents on either platform.
creator: JKeyser@telocity.com

text:
More information - This only appears to occur when ant is run with the Java2 
SDK 1.3 running on Windows Pro 2000.  I ran the same build on a Red Hat Linux 
7.0 machine with Java2 SDK 1.3.0_02, and the resulting jar file did not have 
the same problem.
creator: JKeyser@telocity.com
nico@apache.org
text:
Can you please provide

a) a small test case 
b) the resulting jar file that does not work for you

as this works perfectly well for me (using W2K/SP1 and java version "1.3.0".

One more note - As I was creating the attached test case, I discovered that 
this only occurs when I perform the build on a drive mapped to a network 
share.  Files build with the Java2 SDK "jar" command on the network drive are 
still readable.
creator: JKeyser@telocity.com

text:
Created attachment 112
Jar file of a small test case
creator: JKeyser@telocity.com
JKeyser@telocity.com
text:
Created attachment 113
The jar output by the test case whose contents cannot be read

I have recently installed Windows 2000 Service Pack 2 and restested this 
issue.  This appears to be fixed with Service Pack 2.
creator: JKeyser@telocity.com
